docs.snippet: Eleven hundred graduates of Pace University received their degrees yesterday in the Art Deco splendor of Radio City Music Hall. An additional 2,200 students from the school's Westchester campuses graduated in ceremonies in the last several days.   ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Eleven hundred graduates of Pace University received their degrees yesterday in the Art Deco splendor of Radio City Music Hall. An additional 2,200 students from the school's Westchester campuses graduated in ceremonies in the last several days. The school's president, Dr. Patricia O'Donnell Ewers, gave the commencement address, urging the members of the Class of 1997 to strive for meaningful lives.
docs.abstract: Pace University commencement held, New York City; school's president, Dr Patricia O'Donnell Ewers, gives commencement address; photo (S)

headline.main: Pace Graduates Urged to Seek Meaning

docs.snippet: It was the annual kiddies' day at the French Open, when the gates of Roland Garros are opened to 8,000 high-decibel schoolchildren with no grasp of tennis decorum and no reservations about behaving like babies.     Or like hero worshipers. When No....
docs.lead_paragraph: It was the annual kiddies' day at the French Open, when the gates of Roland Garros are opened to 8,000 high-decibel schoolchildren with no grasp of tennis decorum and no reservations about behaving like babies. Or like hero worshipers. When No. 1-ranked Pete Sampras breezed into the third round with a 6-1, 6-2, 6-2 demolition of Francisco Clavet of Spain, the awestruck kids among the Center Court crowd recited the American's name like a mantra.
docs.abstract: Thomas Muster defeats Jeff Tarango in second round of French Open tennis tournament; Muster refuses to shake hands with Tarango at close of match because of his oddball behavior; photo (M)

headline.main: Muster Outlasts Tarango in Snarling Duel

docs.snippet: AN ambitious, nearly museum-quality exhibition at Jan Krugier Gallery on 57th Street surveys and pays homage to the mature work of Joaquin Torres-Garcia, one of the great late bloomers of modern art.     Torres-Garcia, who was born in Montevideo,...
docs.lead_paragraph: AN ambitious, nearly museum-quality exhibition at Jan Krugier Gallery on 57th Street surveys and pays homage to the mature work of Joaquin Torres-Garcia, one of the great late bloomers of modern art. Torres-Garcia, who was born in Montevideo, Uruguay, in 1874, spent most of his life in pursuit of his true artistic self, as well as financial stability for his family. He didn't really come into his own as an artist until past the age of 50, when he was living in Paris and encountered the Neo-Plasticism of Piet Mondrian and Theo van Doesburg.
docs.abstract: Roberta Smith reviews art by Joaquin Torres-Garcia, at Jan Krugier Gallery; photo (S)

docs.snippet: World Cup Qualifying     Argentina took a big step toward advancing to the World Cup tournament in France next year with a 2-0 triumph over Peru on Sunday. The Argentines also benefited when matches between Uruguay and Colombia, Venezuela and...
docs.lead_paragraph: World Cup Qualifying Argentina took a big step toward advancing to the World Cup tournament in France next year with a 2-0 triumph over Peru on Sunday. The Argentines also benefited when matches between Uruguay and Colombia, Venezuela and Bolivia, and Ecuador and Chile ended in 1-1 ties.

docs.snippet: OVERFISHING by commercial trawlers and oil spills have forced some penguin parents to hunt so far from their Argentine rookeries that their chicks are starving to death before parents can swim back with food.    This grim conclusion comes after a...
docs.lead_paragraph: OVERFISHING by commercial trawlers and oil spills have forced some penguin parents to hunt so far from their Argentine rookeries that their chicks are starving to death before parents can swim back with food. This grim conclusion comes after a study of two male Magellanic penguins whose movements were tracked during the past breeding season by a satellite radio network. The birds, both tagged with tiny sensors and radio transmitters glued to their back feathers, were chosen from a large colony of Magellanic penguins at Punta Tombo on Argentina's Patagonian coast about 120 miles south of Peninsula Valdes.
docs.abstract: Overfishing by commercial trawlers and oil spills force some penguin parents to hunt so far from their Argentine rookeries that their chicks are starving to death before parents can swim back with food; radio transmitter signals show Magellanic penguins at Punta Tombo reserve in Argentina ranging farther from shore for fish, sometimes leaving chicks for weeks; photo (M)

headline.main: Oil and Fishing Force Penguins To Hunt Afar as Chicks Starve

docs.snippet: Fidel Castro has sent senior aides to several Latin American nations to lobby against efforts in the United States Congress to tighten sanctions against Cuba, his Government said today.    A Foreign Ministry spokesman, Miguel Alfonso, acknowledged...
docs.lead_paragraph: Fidel Castro has sent senior aides to several Latin American nations to lobby against efforts in the United States Congress to tighten sanctions against Cuba, his Government said today. A Foreign Ministry spokesman, Miguel Alfonso, acknowledged the purpose of the trips by Foreign Minister Roberto Robaina, Vice President Carlos Lage and Investment Minister Ibrahim Ferradaz but declined to give further details.
docs.abstract: Fidel Castro sends senior aides to several Latin American nations to lobby against efforts in US Congress to tighten sanctions against Cuba (S)y

headline.main: Cuba Lobbies Against U.S. Embargo Effort

docs.snippet: September in Paris     Q.  I plan to be in Paris this September and would like a calendar of cultural events. Where can I find one? -- Seymour Dunn, Hollywood, Fla.    A. Paris Selection, a free monthly publication put out by the Paris Tourist...
docs.lead_paragraph: September in Paris Q. I plan to be in Paris this September and would like a calendar of cultural events. Where can I find one? -- Seymour Dunn, Hollywood, Fla. A. Paris Selection, a free monthly publication put out by the Paris Tourist Office, probably contains the most thorough listing of cultural events. It comes out two weeks before the first of each month, and in your case, the best bet would be to contact the office directly around the first week of August. The mailing address is Service Courrier, Paris Tourist Office, 127 Avenue des Champs-Elysees, 75008 Paris. Call (33-1) 49.52.53.54; fax (33-1) 49.52.53.00. Recorded information in English is available by calling (33-1) 49.52.53.56. You can also find event listings, some with critical commentary, in local newspapers and magazines. For instance, Pariscope, a weekly publication in French, is available at kiosks for about 50 cents.

docs.snippet: Gonzalo Fonseca, a Uruguayan-born artist best known for his stone carvings of enigmatic architectural forms, died on June 11 at his studio in Seravezza, Italy, near the city of Lucca. He was 74.    The cause was a stroke, said his son, Caio, a...
docs.lead_paragraph: Gonzalo Fonseca, a Uruguayan-born artist best known for his stone carvings of enigmatic architectural forms, died on June 11 at his studio in Seravezza, Italy, near the city of Lucca. He was 74. The cause was a stroke, said his son, Caio, a painter.
docs.abstract: Gonzalo Fonseca, artist known for his stone carvings, dies at age 74 (M)

headline.main: Gonzalo Fonseca, 74; Carved Enigmas in Stone

docs.snippet: GOLF     Murphy Grabs Two-Shot Lead     Two weeks off apparently was just what Bob Murphy needed. Murphy, seeking his 12th Senior Tour victory, fired an eight-under-par 64 yesterday to take a two-stroke lead after the first round of the Nationwide...
docs.lead_paragraph: GOLF Murphy Grabs Two-Shot Lead Two weeks off apparently was just what Bob Murphy needed. Murphy, seeking his 12th Senior Tour victory, fired an eight-under-par 64 yesterday to take a two-stroke lead after the first round of the Nationwide Championship at Alpharetta, Ga.
docs.abstract: ResultsPlus column of sports scores and results
